actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on Foreign Relations.

official_title: A bill to establish an Institute for Human Rights and Freedom to promote respect for and observation of human rights and fundamental freedoms in foreign countries.
subjects: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues
subjects_top_term: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

summary.text: Establishes the Institute for Human Rights and Freedom as a United States corporation to furnish technical and financial assistance to nongovernmental organizations that promote human rights in foreign countries, including support for victim support. Requires the Secretary of State to inform the Institute of United States foreign policy related to the Institute. Requires the Institute to consider the foreign policy of the United States in making aid determinations, but declares such determinations shall not be subject to the direction of the United States.

titles.title: A bill to establish an Institute for Human Rights and Freedom to promote respect for and observation of human rights and fundamental freedoms in foreign countries.
